questions.question: What is the title of the article?
questions.answer: Programmed Polarizability Engineering in a Cyclen-Based Cubic Zr(IV) Metal–Organic Framework to Boost Xe/Kr Separation

questions.question: What is the main goal of the study described in the article?
questions.answer: The main goal is to achieve selective separation of Xe/Kr by post-synthetically engineering framework polarizability in a programmable manner using a cubic zirconium-based MOF platform denoted as NU-1107.

questions.question: What method was used for the activation of NU-1107 and its metalated analogues?
questions.answer: Supercritical carbon dioxide (sc-CO2) activation method was used for the activation of NU-1107 and its metalated analogues.

questions.question: True or False: NU-1107-Ag(I) exhibits the best performance for the separation of mixtures of both Xe/Kr and C3H6/C3H8 due to the strongest framework–Xe and −C3H6 interactions.
What is the role of the cyclen moieties in NU-1107?
questions.answer: The cyclen moieties in NU-1107 act as potent chelators to accommodate a series of transition-metal ions including Co, Cu, Pd, and Ag through single-crystal-to-single-crystal transformations, offering an effective strategy to engineer framework polarizability.

questions.question: What is the predicted selectivity of NU-1107-Ag(I) for a 20:80 v/v Xe/Kr mixture at 298 K and 1.0 bar?
questions.answer: The predicted selectivity of NU-1107-Ag(I) for a 20:80 v/v Xe/Kr mixture at 298 K and 1.0 bar is 13.4.

questions.question: True or False: The study demonstrates that NU-1107-Ag(I) has a higher Xe/Kr separation selectivity compared to MOF-525-Ag(II).
What technique was used to confirm the position and coordination environment of the post-synthetically incorporated transition-metal ions?
questions.answer: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction (SCXRD) was used to confirm the position and coordination environment of the post-synthetically incorporated transition-metal ions.

questions.question: True or False: The NU-1107 framework collapses upon direct solvent removal via thermal activation under vacuum.
What is the significance of the study's findings for gas separation technologies?
questions.answer: The study's findings are significant for gas separation technologies as they demonstrate a programmable approach to enhance the separation performance of MOFs for industrially relevant gas mixtures, potentially leading to more efficient and selective gas separation processes.
